Name: Noon Day Ministry - First Baptist Church
Description: Noon Day provides a hot lunch to hundreds of Albuquerque's homeless and  near-homeless population every Tuesday through Friday.  We are not a  soup kitchen, however, but rather we provide full meals.  A typical meal  includes meat, vegetables as well as dessert.  We also provide a small  breakfast to those individuals who come to receive other services.For more infor

Name: Project Share Inc.
Description:
Project Share serves home-style meals 6 nights a week (every day except Wednesdays) from 5 to 6 pm.  We recommend guests arrive by 4:30 p.m.  This is a family friendly environment, supported by more than 400 volunteers.  
We no longer have food boxes. We no longer have a clothing bank.  We just serve wholesome meals to all who come.  
No drugs, no alcohol, no violence tolerated.

Name: Salvation Army-- Women''s Shelter
Description: Our family services emergency assistance programs provide social  services to individuals and familes who are experiencing financial  crises. Our clients are undergoing a temporary stage of financial  hardship and come to this program to stay in their homes, keep their  utilities running, and feed their families.

Name: Saint Martin''s Hospitality Center
